description.narrative: Employment Generation is consistently cited by the Egyptian Government as a priority for post-revolution development assistance, with a particular urgent need to address the high levels of youth unemployment, and encourage increased female employment in the workforce. This funding provides support for two projects that are addressing these critical issues: 1) the International Labour Organisation (ILO)/Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) Decent Jobs for Egypt's Young People Program, which aims to strengthen regional and local level performance in delivering youth employment services; and 2 ) the German Agency for International Cooperation (GIZ) Employment Promotion Programme, which aims to increase the number of career advisors and employment facilitators trained and contracted to employment centres, increase the number of job and training placements made by the centres, raise youth awareness of opportunities offered via blue collar jobs and increase the number of job see
